```{r, include = F}

n <- c(seq(20, 100, 5), 125, 150, 200, 300, 400, 500)
k <- 0:10

tab <- matrix(NA, nrow = length(n), ncol = length(k))
for(rows in 1:length(n)){
  for(columns in 1:length(k)){
    tab[rows, columns] <- log(evaluation(materiality = 0.10, n = n[rows], x = k[columns], prior = auditPrior(method = 'median', materiality = 0.10, likelihood = 'binomial'))$posterior$hypotheses$bf.hmin)
  }
}

table <- as.data.frame(tab)
table <- cbind(n = n, table)
colnames(table) <- c('Sample Size', k)

```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
ktable <- knitr::kable(table, 
                       digits = 2, 
                       caption = "<center>Table 1: Statistical Sampling Results based on the Beta Distribution — <br>Logarithmic Impartial Bayes Factors in favor of Tolerable Misstatement for a Performance Materiality of 10 Percent</center>",
                       align = "l", 
                       format = "html", 
                       row.names = FALSE, 
                       format.args = list(big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE),
                       table.attr = "style='width:150%;'")
ktable <- kableExtra::kable_classic(ktable, position="center", html_font = "Cambria") 
ktable <- kableExtra::add_header_above(ktable, header = c(" " = 1, "Actual Number of Misstatements Found" = 11))
ktable <- kableExtra::footnote(ktable, general = "This table presents Bayes factors based on equal prior probabilities and no expected errors\nBF = e^log(BF)")
ktable <- kableExtra::row_spec(ktable, seq(2, nrow(table)-1, 2), background = "#F0F8FF")
ktable <- kableExtra::kable_styling(ktable, font_size = 11)
kableExtra::kable_paper(ktable, "striped") 
```
